title: use atroche/rust-headless-chrome to extract some json from this page (the one your reading right now)

use atroche/rust-headless-chrome to extract the json from this endpoint's response on the page you are reading right now:

https://cooperative-colossus-630.notion.site/api/v3/loadCachedPageChunk

that `loadCachedPageChunk` is a fetch request that happens when you load this page. to see it open the inspector on this page and refresh this page. 

all the json from that response to that request must be saved to a file when your app runs using headless chrome. 

and thats it! 

simply post the code in a repo on github and share it publicly and show me the link.

IMPORTANT
get me a quote before you start ... i'm talking with another dev to see who is the best fit.

some requirements

-- must write a handler and implement with `enable_resopnse_handling`
		https://docs.rs/headless_chrome/latest/headless_chrome/browser/tab/struct.Tab.html#method.enable_response_handling

-- cannot use javascript in the code
-- code cannot just directly curl the endpoint
-- navigate to the page using the library
-- handler must have some documentation for how it works (i'm new to rust) 
-- must save to file
